name: Audio & Speech
description: Sector template for audio patents including speech processing, audio codecs, and speaker/microphone technology.
contextDescription: Audio patents cover speech and sound processing in electronic devices. Key areas include audio codecs (G10L19), speech recognition (G10L15), speaker/microphone arrays, noise cancellation, and acoustic processing. High-value targets include smartphone vendors (Apple, Samsung), audio chip vendors (Qualcomm, Cirrus Logic), and smart speaker makers (Amazon, Google).
scoringGuidance: Voice assistant patents target Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, Apple Siri.
Noise cancellation patents apply to all ANC headphones and earbuds.
Audio codec patents may be standards-related (AAC, LDAC, aptX).
MEMS microphone patents target mobile devices and smart speakers.
Speaker array/beamforming patents apply to smart speakers and conferencing.

questions.question: What audio function does this patent cover? Score: 1-3 for niche, 4-6 for common (playback, recording), 7-10 for essential (codec, ANC, voice recognition).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the audio function and its prevalence in devices.

questions.question: Does this patent apply to voice assistants (Alexa, Siri, Google Assistant)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Voice assistants are in billions of devices. Assess applicability.

questions.question: How relevant is this patent to mobile device audio (smartphones, tablets, earbuds)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Mobile is the highest-volume audio market.
